		Question: who was saint paul the apostle
		Answer:
answer:
The answer is:

Saint Paul the Apostle was born in Tarsus, which is now Turkey. He was originally named Saul. He was a Pharisee and a Roman citizen when he was born. He became a Christian and changed his name to Paul. He traveled throughout the Roman world spreading the Gospel. He founded churches in many cities. He wrote letters to the Christians and Christians in those cities to help them be stronger in their faith. He was martyred in Rome under Emperor Nero. He is
